newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia's Muliasentra issues convertible bonds.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia's Muliasentra issues convertible bonds.

text.p: Indonesian property investment company PT Muliasentra Gunaswakarya said on Monday it will raise 249.99 billion rupiah through convertible bonds.
The company said the five-year bonds will have a fixed interest of seven percent payable quarterly.
It said the bonds are covertible to shares of PT Mulialand at 3,300 rupiah a share of 1,000 rupiah face value within five trading days before the bonds mature on April 11, 2002.
PT Mulialand is a property developer and a unit of PT Muliasentra.
The bonds, lead managed by PT Jardine Fleming Nusantara and rated BBB plus by the Indonesian rating agency PT Pefindo, have a put and call option.
Muliasentra said proceeds will be loaned to its unit, PT Muliagriya Indah, to finance a property project called Taman Anggrek II.
The bonds, to be offered from March 27 to April 3, will be listed on the Surabaya Stock Exchange on April 21 1997.
